articles.headline: Long Battle on Debt Ending as Senate Set for Final Vote
articles.snippet: In a vote of 269-161, the House passed a landmark agreement, drawing a solid majority of Republicans and about half the Democrats.
articles.abstract: In a vote of 269-161, the House passed a landmark agreement, drawing a solid majority of Republicans and about half the Democrats.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After months of partisan impasse, the House on Monday approved a budget agreement intended to head off a potential government default, pushing Congress a big step closer to the conclusion of a bitter fight that has left both parties bruised and exhausted.

articles.headline: The Airport Experience Now Includes Shopping for the Family
articles.snippet: The draw of airport retailing is simple: an attentive clientele. Domestic travelers spend more than an hour, on average, waiting in airports once they have passed security.
articles.abstract: The draw of airport retailing is simple: an attentive clientele. Domestic travelers spend more than an hour, on average, waiting in airports once they have passed security.
articles.lead_paragraph: After visits to malls plummeted during the recession — and have yet to bounce back — many mass-market retailers stepped up their search for other locations to lure shoppers.

articles.headline: India’s Widening Iron Ore Scandal Hurts Stocks
articles.snippet: In the wake of a government report on corruption, shares of mining companies have lost value, including the flagship of one of India’s richest men.
articles.abstract: In the wake of a government report on corruption, shares of mining companies have lost value, including the flagship of one of India’s richest men.
articles.lead_paragraph: MUMBAI, India — India’s wave of corruption scandals has hit yet another industry, iron ore mining, implicating companies that include the flagship of one of this nation’s richest men.

articles.headline: Pearls, Finer but Still Cheap, Flow From China
articles.snippet: Chinese companies are using new techniques that help make pearls cheaper, throwing the industry into turmoil.
articles.abstract: Chinese companies are using new techniques that help make pearls cheaper, throwing the industry into turmoil.
articles.lead_paragraph: ZHUJI, China — One of the most feared men in the worldwide pearl industry these days is a muscular, Ferrari-driving 40-year-old who is doing the improbable: growing pearls that are nearing the highest quality and may be affordable for middle-class Americans.

articles.headline: Focus Turns Back to Fed on Economy
articles.snippet: Political divisions in Congress have all but immobilized the levers of fiscal policy, raising pressure on the Federal Reserve to address the nation’s economic lethargy.
articles.abstract: Political divisions in Congress have all but immobilized the levers of fiscal policy, raising pressure on the Federal Reserve to address the nation’s economic lethargy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Even as Congress escapes from its brush with default, political divisions have all but immobilized the levers of fiscal policy, raising pressure on the Federal Reserve to address the nation’s economic lethargy.
articles.byline: By Binyamin Appelbaum and Catherine Rampell

articles.headline: Giffords Returns, as Does Unity, Briefly
articles.snippet: Representative Gabrielle Giffords returned to the House for the first time since an assassination attempt in January.
articles.abstract: Representative Gabrielle Giffords returned to the House for the first time since an assassination attempt in January.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — With two minutes to go and roughly 20 votes needed to pass a bill to raise the nation’s debt limit, a smattering of applause rippled from a corner of the House chamber. After a few seconds of confusion, a flash of teal jacket could be seen almost floating among a sea of Democrats.
articles.byline: By Jennifer Steinhauer and Jeff Zeleny

articles.headline: Somalis Waste Away as Insurgents Block Escape From Famine
articles.snippet: The Shabab Islamist insurgent group is imprisoning displaced and starving Somalis who were trying to escape Shabab territory.
articles.abstract: The Shabab Islamist insurgent group is imprisoning displaced and starving Somalis who were trying to escape Shabab territory.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOGADISHU, Somalia — The Shabab Islamist insurgent group, which controls much of southern Somalia, is blocking starving people from fleeing the country and setting up a cantonment camp where it is imprisoning displaced people who were trying to escape Shabab territory.

articles.headline: Debt Bill Is Signed, Ending a Fractious Battle
articles.snippet: President Obama took a final shot at his Republican opposition for what he called a manufactured, and avoidable, crisis.
articles.abstract: President Obama took a final shot at his Republican opposition for what he called a manufactured, and avoidable, crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Senate voted Tuesday to raise the government’s debt ceiling and cut trillions of dollars from its spending, concluding a long and fractious partisan battle just hours before the government’s borrowing authority was set to run out.

articles.headline: Worries Rise Over Spain and Italy Debt
articles.snippet: Investors are returning their attention to the debt woes in Europe, and they do not like what they see.
articles.abstract: Investors are returning their attention to the debt woes in Europe, and they do not like what they see.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Just as European markets seemed to resume their normalcy after the tumult of their sovereign debt crises, the wolves are back at the door.
articles.byline: By Liz Alderman and Matthew Saltmarsh

articles.headline: World Markets Staggered by Weak Consumer Data
articles.snippet: The Standard & Poor’s index erased all of the gains of this year, while the Dow recorded its eighth consecutive day of declines.
articles.abstract: The Standard & Poor’s index erased all of the gains of this year, while the Dow recorded its eighth consecutive day of declines.
articles.lead_paragraph: As the debt limit drama ended in Washington, storm clouds thickened in the financial markets.
